title: Cell Injury
author: ayobami
description: A quiz to define some of the terms used in cell adaptation and injury

questions.question: t(cell injury)
questions.answer: what occurs when a cell gets stressed beyond than its adaptive capabilities

questions.question: t(hypertrophy)
questions.answer: process in which the cell gets larger to increase its function

questions.question: t(hyperplasia)
questions.answer: when the number of a cell-type increases to increase the tissue function

questions.question: t(atrophy)
questions.answer: reduction in the number and size of cells in a tissue

questions.question: t(necrosis)
questions.answer: passive, premature death of a cell caused by external factors

questions.question: t(pyknosis)
questions.answer: shrinking of nucleus of a cell

questions.question: t(blebbing)
questions.answer: formation of outgrowths on the cell membrane due to cytoskeleton damage

questions.question: t(free radicals)
questions.answer: a molecule with an unpaired electron in its outermost shell

questions.question: t(hypoxia)
questions.answer: a state of lower than normal oxygen in a cell or tissue

questions.question: t(ischemia)
questions.answer: lack of adequate blood supply to an area, usually due to mechanical blokage

questions.question: t(ischemic reperfusion injury)
questions.answer: worsening of injury caused by restoration of blood to ischemic tissue

questions.question: t(metaplasia)
questions.answer: replacement of a differentiated cell type by another cell type to withstand adverse conditions
